title: World Energy and World Fuel Services extend partnership with a six-year, up to 27 million-gallon purchasing agreement - PR Newswire
summary: World Energy announced a six-year agreement with World Fuel Services to provide sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) that could reduce air travel emissions by 200,000 metric tonnes. The SAF is produced from renewable feedstocks and is certified to reduce emissions by 84% compared to traditional jet fuel. This partnership aims to support the aviation industry's decarbonization efforts by increasing the availability of SAF. Additionally, World Energy controls the entire production process within the United States, ensuring sustainability.

title: How chemists could give new life to old wind turbine blades - MIT Technology Review
summary: Researchers at Aarhus University developed a method to recycle wind turbine blades made from durable plastics and fiberglass, which are not currently recyclable. The new approach breaks down the epoxy resin in a way that preserves the glass fibers for reuse. This innovation addresses the environmental challenge posed by the expected disposal of millions of tons of wind turbine blades by 2050.
